summary:
Tetanus, or lockjaw, is a serious infection caused by bacteria called *Clostridium tetani*. It makes your muscles tighten and spasm, starting in the jaw and spreading. Symptoms can include fever and trouble swallowing. It's usually caused by a cut or wound that gets infected with bacteria found in soil or manure.

You can prevent tetanus with a vaccine. If you get infected, doctors use immune globulin and clean the wound. Tetanus is rare in the US, with about 30 cases yearly, mostly in unvaccinated people. It's more common in hot, wet areas with rich soil.
title: Tetanus
